intro: Borneocola salahuddinianus, commonly known as the Borneo starwood, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of primary forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
